      • checkCollisionRectCirc

      • collidesWith

        public boolean collidesWith​(Collider other)
        example of how to implement own colliders. This one check for collisions with instances of itself, and of CircleCollider. For this, the code tries to cast the parameter other to both classes. If it is possible, collision is evaluated. If not, an exception is raised to signal that the collider type cannot be handled.
        Specified by:
        collidesWith in class Collider
        Parameters:
        other - subclass of Collider
        Returns:
        false or true
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if other cannot be handled
